abstract: Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi nominates Ignazio Visco to succeed Mario Draghi as governor of the Bank of Italy, ending prolonged impasse.
snippet: Ignazio Visco, currently the No. 3 official at the bank, was nominated to replace Mario Draghi as bank governor, just days before Mr. Draghi is to take over as president of the European Central Bank.
lead_paragraph: Ignazio Visco, currently the No. 3 official at the bank, was nominated to replace Mario Draghi as bank governor, just days before Mr. Draghi is to take over as president of the European Central Bank.

headline.main: Appointment Ends Impasse on Bank of Italy Leadership
headline.print_headline: Appointment Ends Impasse On Bank of Italy Leadership
headline.seo: Berlusconi Chooses Ignazio Visco to Head Bank of Italy
